results.title: Games: the Philippines
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation and Soerabaia Pictures
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Kids next door”.
Shows a variety of games played by Filipino children as well as toys made by them. Includes the indigenous and English names for the games. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Games of the XXI Olympiad: Montreal 1976
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Ashley Murray, Jean Beaudin, Marcel Carriere and Georges Dufaux
results.brief_description: The official film of the Games of the XXI Olympiad, Montreal, 1976. A unique special for world television audiences, it probes behind the scenes, capturing the emotional dimensions of the athlete and his or her sport. It highlights certain teams and participants, before, during and after their events. This film approaches each event with the intention of revealing the athlete as an individual.

results.title: Games in the primary school (TEFC)
results.brief_description: The purpose of games in the primary school is to develop children’s basic skills and attitudes. This film shows how a teacher in a primary school structures a physical education lesson to develop a repertoire of skills children can use in games they will be playing later on.

results.title: Games futurists play
results.creator_credit: James Jackson, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
An examination of some of the methods humans are utilising in their search for knowledge of existing social problems as well as projected social problems of the future. This film introduces us to new games now being played to prepare us for tomorrow. As we witness three such games, we see that apart from their childish role-playing aspect they can be constructive also.

results.title: Games and pastimes
results.brief_description: Top spinning competitions; kiteflying - often with elaborately painted kites; a type of football played with a woven cane ball; a form of self-defence, once serious and now a sport; traditional dances and new dances in traditional style; all a part of the leisure of Malayans, young and old.

results.title: Gameplan: The Language & Strategy of Pro Football
results.brief_description: John Riggins of the Washington Redskins and Los Angeles Raiders head coach, Tom Flores explain some of the mysteries of gridiron. Part one looks at terminology, skills and strategy and part two profiles each NFL team taking a detailed look at some of their signature plays.

results.title: Game to Play
results.brief_description: A look at the ongoing problems that involve both children and adults, with junior sports participation. Parent’s, teachers, coaches and children themselves discuss the pro’s and con’s of competitive sport.

results.title: Game Masters: Yuji Naka interview
results.creator_credit: ACMI Media Studio, ACMI Content Development and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Yuji Naka is a videogame designer and programmer, best known as the former head of Sonic Team, where he was the lead programmer of the original ‘Sonic the Hedgehog’. Naka reveals his initial desire to make arcade games and the influence that Yu Suzuki has had on his career as a programmer. Since 2006 he has been the head of Prope, an independent game company he founded after leaving SEGA.
Yuji gives great insights into the development and creation of ‘Sonic the Hedgehog 1 and 2’, ‘Nights into Dreams’ and ‘Chu Chu Rocket’.
NB: This interview was conducted in Yuji Naka’s native language of Japanese and features English subtitles. Interviewer is neither seen nor heard onscreen.
